description: This function generates a quadrilateral with a specified number of parallel sides (0, 1, or 2 pairs) and applies a random rotation if requested. The visual output is a colorful, potentially rotated quadrilateral, which can be used to help students visualize and understand different types of quadrilaterals and their properties.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Quadrilaterals with Specified Parallel Sides
stimulus_type_specification.description: This function can draw three types of quadrilaterals: irregular quadrilaterals with no parallel sides, trapezoids with one pair of parallel sides, and parallelograms (including squares and rectangles) with two pairs of parallel sides. It accepts a ParallelQuadrilateral object as input, which specifies the number of parallel sides and whether to apply a random rotation. The function generates the appropriate quadrilateral, applies the rotation if requested, and then plots the quadrilateral with a random color. This function is useful for teaching students about the properties of different types of quadrilaterals and the concept of rotation.

details: num_parallel_sides: The number of pairs of parallel sides in the quadrilateral (0, 1, or 2).
rotate: A boolean value indicating whether to apply a random rotation to the quadrilateral.
The num_parallel_sides value must be 0, 1, or 2. Any other values will not generate a valid quadrilateral.
The rotate value must be a boolean. If it is not specified, no rotation will be applied.
The function draws a quadrilateral with the specified number of parallel sides. The quadrilateral is filled with a random color and outlined with the same color.
If the rotate parameter is true, the quadrilateral is randomly rotated.
If the quadrilateral is a square or rectangle, right angle markers are added.

educational_standards.description: Recognize and describe basic geometric features: edges, vertices, parallel sides, and right angles.
